birth_place.zh-cn: 大清直隶省顺天府肃亲王府
birth_place.en: Prince Su's Mansion, Shuntian Prefecture, Zhili Province, Great Qing

death_place.zh-cn: 中华民国北平市北平第一监狱
death_place.en: Beiping No. 1 Prison, Beiping, Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 原名爱新觉罗·显玗，满洲镶白旗人，清朝皇族，是第十代和硕肃亲王善耆的第十四女。后被日本人川岛浪速收养，成为效忠于日本、满洲国等多方的间谍。第二次世界大战结束后，被中华民国国民政府以汉奸罪判处死刑。
description.en: Original name Aisin-Gioro Xianyu, a Manchu of the Bordered White Banner and a member of the Qing imperial family, being the 14th daughter of the 10th generation Prince Su, Shanqi. She was later adopted by the Japanese Kawashima Naniwa and became a spy loyal to Japan, Manchukuo, and other parties. After World War II, she was sentenced to death for treason by the Nationalist Government of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 清朝皇族，第十代和硕肃亲王，川岛芳子的生父。
description.en: A member of the Qing imperial family, the 10th generation Prince Su, and the biological father of Kawashima Yoshiko.

description.zh-cn: 日本人，川岛芳子的养父，对她进行了政治、军事和情报训练。
description.en: A Japanese national and the adoptive father of Kawashima Yoshiko, who provided her with political, military, and intelligence training.

description.zh-cn: 蒙古族，巴布扎布次子，川岛芳子的丈夫，曾一同参与满蒙独立运动。
description.en: Of Mongol ethnicity, the second son of Babujab, and the husband of Kawashima Yoshiko. He participated in the Manchuria-Mongolia Independence Movement with her.

description.zh-cn: 日本人，川岛芳子的伴侣。
description.en: A Japanese national and the partner of Kawashima Yoshiko.

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子的妹妹。
description.en: The younger sister of Kawashima Yoshiko.

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子的兄长。
description.en: The older brother of Kawashima Yoshiko.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军驻上海的特务机关长，曾与川岛芳子同居。
description.en: The head of the Japanese Army's special intelligence agency in Shanghai, who once lived with Kawashima Yoshiko.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军将领，川岛芳子的义父，曾支持她成为安国军总司令。
description.en: A general in the Japanese Army and the godfather of Kawashima Yoshiko, who supported her in becoming the commander of the Anguojun.

description.zh-cn: 中国影星，曾声称川岛芳子并未被处决而是被美国救走。
description.en: A Chinese movie star who claimed that Kawashima Yoshiko was not executed but was rescued by the United States.

description.zh-cn: 清朝时期的北京地区，是川岛芳子的出生地。
description.en: The Beijing area during the Qing Dynasty, the birthplace of Kawashima Yoshiko.

nodes.id: 日本长野县松本蚁之崎高等学校

zh-cn: 日本长野县松本蚁之崎高等学校
en: Matsumoto Arigasaki High School, Nagano Prefecture, Japan

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子曾就读的学校。
description.en: The school that Kawashima Yoshiko attended.

description.zh-cn: 日本于1932年至1945年间在中国东北建立的傀儡政权，川岛芳子曾为其效力。
description.en: A puppet state established by Japan in Northeast China from 1932 to 1945, for which Kawashima Yoshiko served.

description.zh-cn: 满洲国的一支军队，川岛芳子曾担任其总司令。
description.en: An army of Manchukuo, of which Kawashima Yoshiko was the commander-in-chief.

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子作为间谍主要效忠的国家。
description.en: The country to which Kawashima Yoshiko was primarily loyal as a spy.

description.zh-cn: 1912年至1949年期间统治中国大陆的政府。该政府在战后逮捕、审判并处决了川岛芳子。
description.en: The government that ruled mainland China from 1912 to 1949. This government arrested, tried, and executed Kawashima Yoshiko after the war.

description.zh-cn: 国民政府的军事情报机构，于1945年逮捕了川岛芳子。
description.en: The military intelligence agency of the Nationalist Government, which arrested Kawashima Yoshiko in 1945.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期的一家法院，于1947年判处川岛芳子死刑。
description.en: A court during the Republic of China era, which sentenced Kawashima Yoshiko to death in 1947.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国陆军的一部分，驻扎在中国东北。因川岛芳子释放被其逮捕的中国人而视其为双重间谍。
description.en: A part of the Imperial Japanese Army stationed in Northeast China. It considered Kawashima Yoshiko a double agent because she released Chinese prisoners arrested by them.

description.zh-cn: 中国的最后一个帝制朝代，川岛芳子出身于其皇族。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty of China, to whose imperial family Kawashima Yoshiko was born.

description.zh-cn: 据影星白光称，美国在川岛芳子被处决前将其救出。
description.en: According to actress Bai Guang, the United States rescued Kawashima Yoshiko before her execution.

description.zh-cn: 一项旨在将满洲和内蒙古从中国分离出去的政治运动，川岛芳子曾参与其中。
description.en: A political movement aimed at separating Manchuria and Inner Mongolia from China, in which Kawashima Yoshiko participated.

description.zh-cn: 日本帝国旨在征服亚洲大陆的扩张主义政策，川岛芳子曾公开批判此政策。
description.en: An expansionist policy of the Empire of Japan aimed at conquering the Asian continent, which Kawashima Yoshiko publicly criticized.

description.zh-cn: 日本关东军策划并执行的入侵中国东北的事件，川岛芳子曾作为间谍暗中参与。
description.en: An event staged by the Japanese Kwantung Army as a pretext for the invasion of northeastern China, in which Kawashima Yoshiko secretly participated as a spy.

description.zh-cn: 中日两国在上海发生的军事冲突，川岛芳子曾作为间谍暗中参与。
description.en: A military conflict between China and Japan in Shanghai, in which Kawashima Yoshiko secretly participated as a spy.

description.zh-cn: 日本侵略热河省的战役，川岛芳子率领安国军参与其中。
description.en: A campaign in which Japan invaded Jehol Province, in which Kawashima Yoshiko participated leading the Anguojun.

description.zh-cn: 指通敌或叛国的罪名，是川岛芳子被判处死刑的法律依据。
description.en: A charge of collaboration or treason, which was the legal basis for Kawashima Yoshiko's death sentence.

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子是善耆的第十四女。
description.en: Kawashima Yoshiko was the 14th daughter of Shanqi.

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子是川岛浪速的养女。
description.en: Kawashima Yoshiko was the adopted daughter of Kawashima Naniwa.

description.zh-cn: 1927年11月，川岛芳子与甘珠尔扎布在旅顺结婚。
description.en: In November 1927, Kawashima Yoshiko married Ganjuurjab in Lüshun.

description.zh-cn: 根据资料，小野菊子是川岛芳子的伴侣。
description.en: According to records, Ono Kikuko was the partner of Kawashima Yoshiko.

description.zh-cn: 金默玉是川岛芳子的妹妹。
description.en: Jin Moyu was the younger sister of Kawashima Yoshiko.

description.zh-cn: 金壁东是川岛芳子的兄长。
description.en: Jin Bidong was the older brother of Kawashima Yoshiko.

description.zh-cn: 1931年，川岛芳子与日本陆军驻上海的特务机关长田中隆吉同居。
description.en: In 1931, Kawashima Yoshiko lived with Tanaka Ryukichi, the head of the Japanese Army's special intelligence agency in Shanghai.

relationships.target: 日本长野县松本蚁之崎高等学校

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子出身于清朝皇族。
description.en: Kawashima Yoshiko was born into the Qing imperial family.

description.zh-cn: 川岛浪速对养女川岛芳子进行了政治、军事、情报等多方面的专门训练。
description.en: Kawashima Naniwa provided his adopted daughter, Kawashima Yoshiko, with specialized training in politics, military, and intelligence.

description.zh-cn: 在川岛芳子的公审期间，其养父川岛浪速提供的证词对她极为不利，直接导致她被认定为中国国籍并以汉奸罪判处死刑。
description.en: During Kawashima Yoshiko's public trial, the testimony provided by her adoptive father, Kawashima Naniwa, was extremely unfavorable, directly leading to her being identified as a Chinese national and sentenced to death for treason.

description.zh-cn: 在义父多田骏的支持下，川岛芳子成为满洲国“安国军”总司令。
description.en: With the support of her godfather, Tada Hayao, Kawashima Yoshiko became the commander-in-chief of the Manchukuo 'Anguojun'.

description.zh-cn: 1933年，川岛芳子被多田骏送回日本软禁。
description.en: In 1933, Kawashima Yoshiko was sent back to Japan and placed under house arrest by Tada Hayao.

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子与其丈夫甘珠尔扎布一同参与了满蒙独立运动。
description.en: Kawashima Yoshiko, along with her husband Ganjuurjab, participated in the Manchuria-Mongolia Independence Movement.

description.zh-cn: 甘珠尔扎布与其妻子川岛芳子一同参与了满蒙独立运动。
description.en: Ganjuurjab, along with his wife Kawashima Yoshiko, participated in the Manchuria-Mongolia Independence Movement.

description.zh-cn: 作为日本间谍，川岛芳子暗中参与了九一八事变。
description.en: As a Japanese spy, Kawashima Yoshiko secretly participated in the Mukden Incident.

description.zh-cn: 作为日本间谍，川岛芳子暗中参与了一二八事变。
description.en: As a Japanese spy, Kawashima Yoshiko secretly participated in the January 28 incident.

description.zh-cn: 作为日本间谍，川岛芳子参与了组建满洲国的活动。
description.en: As a Japanese spy, Kawashima Yoshiko participated in the activities to establish Manchukuo.

description.zh-cn: 1933年初，川岛芳子率领安国军参加了热河战役。
description.en: In early 1933, Kawashima Yoshiko led the Anguojun to participate in the Battle of Rehe.

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子在日本电台广播中强烈批判了日本军部的大陆政策。
description.en: Kawashima Yoshiko strongly criticized the Japanese military's Continental Policy in a radio broadcast in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 由于川岛芳子利用权力释放被关东军逮捕的中国人，她被日军视为双重间谍。
description.en: Because Kawashima Yoshiko used her power to release Chinese people arrested by the Kwantung Army, she was considered a double agent by the Japanese military.

description.zh-cn: 1945年10月，川岛芳子被国民政府军统局逮捕。
description.en: In October 1945, Kawashima Yoshiko was arrested by the Bureau of Investigation and Statistics of the Nationalist Government.

description.zh-cn: 1947年10月22日，河北高等法院以汉奸罪判处川岛芳子死刑。
description.en: On October 22, 1947, the Hebei High Court sentenced Kawashima Yoshiko to death for treason.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民政府逮捕、审判并最终于1948年3月25日以枪决方式处决了川岛芳子。
description.en: The Nationalist Government of the Republic of China arrested, tried, and ultimately executed Kawashima Yoshiko by firing squad on March 25, 1948.

description.zh-cn: 川岛芳子被以汉奸罪名提出公诉，并最终被判处死刑。
description.en: Kawashima Yoshiko was prosecuted on the charge of Hanjian (treason) and was ultimately sentenced to death.

description.zh-cn: 影星白光在1978年受访时声称，她最后一次见到川岛芳子是在1947年。
description.en: In a 1978 interview, actress Bai Guang claimed that she last saw Kawashima Yoshiko in 1947.

description.zh-cn: 据影星白光声称，美国救了川岛芳子并安排其出逃。
description.en: According to actress Bai Guang, the United States rescued Kawashima Yoshiko and arranged for her escape.

description.zh-cn: 安国军是满洲国的一支军队。
description.en: The Anguojun was an army of Manchukuo.
